page.title: 01BOVINGDON
page.content: Bovingdon is a village on the edge of Hertfordshire near the boundary with Buckinghamshire. It is a part of the Dacorum District of Hertfordshire which is centered around Hemel Hempstead. Bovingdon is only 3 miles from Hemel Hempstead. The population records normally include the smaller village of Flaunden which is just outside this survey block to the west. At the last census the population was just over 3000, three- quarters of whom were from Bovingdon. The village is on top of a hill between the valleys of the rivers Bulbourne and Chess. Most of the land is divided into fields with a wide variety of crops being grown. Part of the land to the north of the village is taken up with the disused airfield.
